introduction: In this video, Sasha C, a UX designer studying Human-Computer Interaction (HCI) at Depaul University, provides an overview of the major, its jobs, and the classes taken in the program. Sasha emphasizes the importance of the major for those interested in solving problems through technology and the high earning potential in various fields.

sections.title: Section 1: Introduction to Human-Computer Interaction
content: HCI is a field of study that involves understanding human interaction with technology and improving it.
HCI encompasses various roles, including UX designers, UI designers, information architects, tech startups, computer programmers, systems engineers, and frontend developers.
HCI focuses on both functional and entertaining aspects of technology.
HCI is a growing field with numerous job opportunities.

sections.title: Section 2: HCI Classes at Depaul University
content: Sasha has completed several HCI classes at Depaul University, including User Research Methods, Statistics and Data Analysis, Website Design, Scripting for Interactive Systems, HCI Fundamentals, Global User Research, Center Design, Behavioral Science, and User Experience.
These classes provide a comprehensive understanding of HCI concepts and skills.
HCI classes cover various topics, such as user research, information architecture, website design, scripting, and behavioral science.
HCI classes are essential for a successful career in the field.

sections.title: Section 3: Why Study Human-Computer Interaction
content: Studying HCI allows individuals to solve problems through technology.
HCI is a rapidly growing field with numerous job opportunities.
HCI combines both functional and entertaining aspects of technology.
HCI requires a combination of technical and interpersonal skills.

sections.title: Section 4: HCI Jobs and Earnings
content: There are many jobs available in the HCI field, including UX designer, UI designer, information architect, tech startup, computer programmer, systems engineer, and frontend developer.
HCI jobs offer high earning potential.
HCI jobs require a combination of technical and interpersonal skills.
HCI jobs are in high demand.

sections.title: Section 5: Gaining Experience in HCI
content: Gaining experience in HCI is crucial for success in the field.
Individuals can gain experience by working on personal projects, participating in hackathons, and collaborating with other designers.
HCI experience can be gained through internships and freelance work.
HCI experience is highly valued by employers.
